messages.content: What does the ComfyUI-AutoCropFaces node do?
The ComfyUI-AutoCropFaces node uses RetinaFace to detect and automatically crop faces in images.
What is the default value for the 'number_of_faces' parameter in the Auto Crop Faces node?
The default value for the 'number_of_faces' parameter is 5.
What does the 'start_index' parameter control in the Auto Crop Faces node?
The 'start_index' parameter determines which face to start with when detecting multiple faces. It is the starting index of the detected faces list.
What is the default value for the 'scale_factor' parameter in the Auto Crop Faces node?
The default value for the 'scale_factor' parameter is 1.5.
How can you control the position of the cropped face in the output image using the Auto Crop Faces node?

You can control the position of the cropped face in the output image using the 'shift_factor' parameter. Setting it to 0 places the face at the top edge, 0.5 centers it, and 1.0 places it at the bottom edge.
What is the maximum number of faces that can be detected for each image using the Auto Crop Faces node?
The maximum number of faces that can be detected for each image is 1000, controlled by the 'max_faces_per_image' parameter.
What is the default aspect ratio for cropping in the Auto Crop Faces node?
The default aspect ratio for cropping in the Auto Crop Faces node is 1:1.
What is the recommended node to use before the Auto Crop Faces node when dealing with large images?
It is recommended to use the 'Constrain Image' node before the Auto Crop Faces node when dealing with large images.
Is the Auto Crop Faces node compatible with the WAS node suite?
Yes, the Auto Crop Faces node supports CROP_DATA, making it compatible with the WAS node suite.
